Author: tchitouniaram
Review_Title: Nothing to do with Paranormal Activity ...
Review: Except name there is nothing even remotely close to the original franchise , saying that , it is a very decent found footage horror film. Kept me interested right to the end .Nothing really special , but definitely worth to watch once !

Author: trashgang
Review_Title: nothing to do with the franchise
Review: This franchise was loved or hated by the fans. Still it was original in it's concept and due teens being afraid of the first entry it became a succes.

Author: kevin_robbins
Review_Title: I wouldnt call it the best Parabormal Activity movie but it's worth a viewing
Review: Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin (2021) is a movie I recently watched on Paramount+. The storyline follows an orphaned young lady who traces her roots back to a Mormon society in the country. They take her in with open arms and show her their ways and tell her the story of her mother. As she stays with them she starts seeing weird phenomenon by the woods and around a rundown church. If she digs too much into her family history she may find more than she wants to know.

Author: elliotjeory
Review: I had low expectations for this film and I was suprised when it turned out to be a good thriller. It's an interesting story and it's creepy in parts. It's better than some paranormal activity sequels which may not be saying much but if you like creepy horrors it's worth a watch.

Author: jtindahouse
Review_Title: Has nothing that used to make the Paranormal Activity movies great
Review: 'Paranormal Activity' films used to be the staple of every Halloween. They were remarkably consistent right up until the very unfortunate 'Ghost Dimension' which killed the series. Now, years later, we have another entry in the 'Paranormal Activity' series. The only problem is that it is a part of the series in name only. It has no connection to the previous films and it has nothing that demands it be a 'Paranormal Activity' movie. It could be any old found footage film - and not a very good one at that.

Author: YRLY59E
Review_Title: Moderately more entertaining than some of the others in the series
Review: I mean it's not bad, it creates a good found footage atmosphere a few elements are just a bit too cheesy and some of the shots detract from the ambiance. Maybe 15 min less chopping some of the cheesiest parts and a few of the camera cuts would have made this a really decent movie. As it stands it's kinda long. It's still entertaining enough and just creepy enough to make a good watch for the Halloween weekend.

Author: Fortressofdoors
Review: I won't go into it too much because it would be basically a repeat of what has already been said. This is not a Paranormal Activity movie, it just borrows from the name for promotional purposes. For that, I was disappointed.

Author: kuarinofu
Review: I might be somewhat biased cause I enjoy Eubank's works to a certain extent. I think he's consistently almost a good director. The Signal was an interesting starting project, Underwater was too rushed and too focused on Steward though.

Author: jmbwithcats
Review: I'm watching Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin and honestly, even though some say it's a reboot or unrelated, it feels completely related to the series... the Amish family teaching the children in part 5 are a lot like perhaps who these people are before they came to the city.

Author: stellafoster
Review_Title: Watchable but not a PA film
Review: I love the PA franchise because they were original back in the day, and they scared the bejesus out of me. The third movie is my favourite. That rotating fan in the kitchen!!!!

Author: S_dot_M_dot
Review: Tracked down by a distant relative after being abandoned by her mother, Margot (Emily Bader) gets a documentary crew to get a first-hand account of where she is from. Traveling to Amish country alongside Chris (Roland Buck III) and sound guy Dale (Dan Lippert), Margot discovers the way of life her true family lives. Night after night of unsettling encounters, Margot soon discovers why her mother may have given her up.

Author: SoumikBanerjee25
Review_Title: The Last Act More Than Makes Up For It
Review: I'm probably one of those very few people who continue to have a soft spot for this franchise. Don't know about the others, but for me 'Paranormal Activity will forever have a special place in my heart. Cause, it is precisely what introduced me to this rather deserted realm of Found Footage and now being an admirer of the same, I couldn't feel more indebted.

Author: alexfiles
Review: That's pretty much it! Emily Bader did a great job, as did the rest of the cast. If this is the kind of movie you like, this is a good movie!

Author: Draysan-Jennings
Review: I've always been a fan of the Paranormal Activity movies. I think this is one of the better films in the series. There was a few twists here and there but a lot of it was fairly predictable. You'd have to be oblivious if you didn't figure out the plot after the first 30 minutes. Either way I still enjoyed this film. I liked the new concept and most importantly it held my attention. Definitely a film worth checking out.

Author: phenomynouss
Review_Title: moderately interesting flim marred by bad technical decisions
Review: Whether by attaching itself to the Paranormal Activity franchise or some other reason, this film commits itself to being a found footage style horror film. This works great for most of the Paranormal Activity films, and even works out nicely for many parts of this film.

Author: queeroid
Review_Title: The Halloween III of the Paranormal Activity franchise
Review: It's a good found footage(-ish) film. But it's not great. And it _definitely_ should not be called Paranormal Activity. The cash grab of slapping that name onto the title is a big mistake that just ruins it for the people who would watch it. I'll explain...

Author: begob
Review: A woman once abandoned as an orphan leads a documentary film crew into Amish country to record her first encounter with blood relatives, but their welcome disguises a chilling fate ...

Author: paul_haakonsen
Review: When I sat down to watch the 2021 horror movie "Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin", I must admit that I wasn't really expecting much of anything grand here, as the movies have been dull, uneventful and over-hyped since the very first movie. Yet, I have stuck with the franchise and watched the movies as the years went by, hoping that eventually the franchise would get better.

Author: SnoopyStyle
Review: Margot with her friends Chris and Dale are filming her quest to find her biological family. She was adopted after being abandon at a hospital. Her search leads to Amish country and a dark secret world.

Author: FixedYourEnding
Review_Title: Franchise or not, this is a solid horror movie
Review: I actually liked it. The "found footage" genre is always questionable. It was done impeccably in the 1st movie in the franchise by Oren Peli, it is not perfect here and might bother some people, the idea is that "found footage" plays tricks with you mind to the level of "maybe it actually did happen", this would not be the case here, so the camera style here doesn't add much, it could have just been filmed in a regular manner. It seems this addition to the "Paranormal activity" franchise was done mainly to attract viewers, which I'm sure was successful on that front, due to the large number of fans of this franchise.

Author: subxerogravity
Review_Title: More thrilling as a franchise than scary as a stand alone
Review: I'll start by saying that I prefer to see a paranormal activity movie at the movie theatre vs. At home. I always enjoyed the experience better there.

Author: saysjenn
Review: It wasn't awful and followed the paranormal activity formula of scary. The setting as quite different at an Amish home. The environment was very creepy and had some good scares. It's worth watching if you like the franchise.

Author: gab-67599
Review: You know those movies you wish would keep going just so you could see how it all turned out. This was one of those movies. Let me first say if you do NOT like found footage you will not appreciate this movie. Although the start was VERY slow... the end was extremely powerful that energy at the end was what I had hope for the whole movie to be but it just wasn't. I honestly jumped a few times so it was not all bad.

Author: koltonbrett
Review_Title: Entertaining though we pretty much know what's coming.
Review: Next of Kin is the SEVENTH installment of the Paranormal Activity franchise. Rather than a continuation of the previous films, Next of Kin is supposed to be a reboot. As a stand alone movie, it's decently entertaining. As a reboot, it really needed to be better. It's not boring, it's just not anything extraordinarily interesting. It feels like a very familiar demonic horror film. From the get go, you have a general idea of where things are going. The title of this movie gives too much away. I enjoyed the isolated Amish country setting. There's the creepy old house, no electricity, no phone service, and they're surrounded by woods and farmland. It's indeed a spooky setting for a scary story. The weaknesses of this movie are its run-of-the-mill storyline and lack of scares. I remember the first Paranormal Activity being truly chilling. I wasn't chilled this time but there are suspenseful moments that hold the attention. I appreciated some of the creativity with the found footage filming technique. It separates itself from older found footage horror movies by displaying some modern technology capabilities. For example, drone usage and slow motion shots. The acting is good here and the characters are interesting enough. They keep us engaged throughout.

Author: Go_For_The_Jugular
Review: Ok, so I'm over the moon to know that the Paranormal Activity franchise is still going strong...there's another one due in 2022, but I'm disappointed that after all this time, this is the best they could come up with.
